snippet: With no Muslims prosecuted in at least five killings in the violence, the military-backed government was accused of breaking a promise to curb bias.
abstract: Three Coptic Christians in Egypt are given long prison sentences over death of Muslim in sectarian clash, despite fact that deaths of at least five Christians in the same clash have brought no prosecutions; event rankles Christians and raises allegations that military-backed government is breaking its promise to curb bias against Christians.
lead_paragraph: With no Muslims prosecuted in at least five killings in the violence, the military-backed government was accused of breaking a promise to curb bias.

headline.main: Egyptian Christians Bridle at Prison Terms for Copts Only in Fatal Clash
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Christians Bridle at Prison Terms for Copts Only in Fatal Clash
